item.description: <p>St Kilda ﻿beach and the marina are almost unrecognisable today as the popular waterway undergoes a week-long operation to deepen the St Kilda Marina Entrance Channel.</p>

item.title: Death toll from Hurricane Melissa rises to 45 in Jamaica
item.description: <p>A﻿uthorities say two towns on the Caribbean island nation remain cut off as 15 people remain missing.</p>

item.title: Three-hatted Sydney restaurant Oncore by Clare Smyth to close after four years
item.description: <p>The fine-dining eatery, which boasts sweeping views of Sydney Harbour from its level 26 perch in Barangaroo, is scheduled to remain open until February 28.</p>

item.title: Seven charged after police officers assaulted during arrest in NSW
item.description: <p>The incident began when police were called to a car after reports of alleged drug activity.</p>

item.title: MP to launch High Court challenge against 'unconstitutional' social media ban
item.description: <p>The federal government&#x27;s world-first social media ban is weeks away from coming into effect. </p>

item.title: Aurora australis to be visible for large parts of Australia in rare event
item.description: <p>The aurora australis will be on display for mid to southe﻿rn parts of Australia thanks to a severe geomagnetic storm impacting Earth. </p>

item.title: 'Part of me is gone': Family's grief over teenager's murder of grandmother Vyleen White
item.description: <p>The family of a grandmother killed in a fatal stabbing that sparked landmark law reforms has broken down as they spoke of the horror attack&#x27;s impact.</p>

item.title: Jack Schlossberg, John F Kennedy's grandson, running for US House seat
item.description: <p>In a video announcing his campaign, Schlossberg says the &quot;country is at a turning point.&quot;</p>

item.title: Jewish group calls for Adass Israel Synagogue arson accused to be refused bail
item.description: <p>A Jewish congregation has urged a magistrate to keep an accused synagogue arsonist behind bars, telling the court they were still traumatised by the attack.</p>

item.title: Western Australia's energy retailers all overcharged hundreds of customers
item.description: <p>An industry watchdog has found all seven of Western Australia&#x27;s energy retailers have overcharged hundreds of customers in the past two years.</p>

item.title: Liberals set to dump net zero after marathon five-hour meeting
item.description: <p>In a five-hour meeting in Parliament House, MPs debated what to do with the emissions reduction target set by Liberal prime minister Scott Morrison in 2021.</p>

item.title: Children aged 14 and above to face adult sentences under Victorian crime crackdown
item.description: <p>Victoria&#x27;s premier unveiled a raft of new justice reforms today aimed at tackling the state&#x27;s crime wave.</p>

item.title: Shark attack victim's widow speaks out for first time to push for more protections
item.description: <p>After two months, Maria Psillakis felt it was time to tell everyone about her husband, Mercury Psillakis, who lost his life following a shark attack in Sydney&#x27;s northern beaches.</p>

item.title: Minister clarifies confusing laws after woman's fear she won't be buried with late husband
item.description: <p>A classification of Gaye Wheatley&#x27;s farm raised fears that she would not be laid to rest with her late husband, Ned. </p>

item.title: Woolworths opens Customer Fulfilment Centre in Adelaide amid online shopping surge
item.description: <p>The facility is the size of two football fields, stocks more than 25,000 products, and aims to serve about 15,000 customers weekly through same-day and next-day home delivery services.</p>

item.title: 'This is my life': Owners forced to rebuild after fire destroys popular Italian restaurant
item.description: <p>Abi Haddad and Ralph Hanako owned the business for 27 years. </p>

item.description: <p>S﻿ources said the UK was concered about the legality of the missile strikes, and did not want to be complicit.</p>
